comment.author: 23212881@N06
comment._content: A comprehensive biography can be accessed online at: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Marcel_Navratil

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Their real names were Michel and Edmond Navratil, ages 2 and 4. The boys had been abducted from France by their father, who drowned when the Titanic went down. Their mother later learned of their fate, and sailed to New York to claim them and take them back to France. Michel, the oldest, lived to age 92. More data, including a link to a Wikipedia story, in the comments under this photo: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2535973345/ [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2535973345/] Another Bain/LOC photo of the tiny Titanic survivors: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163883112/]

comment.author: 54017078@N00
comment._content: The younger child is holding a miniature ship! That had better not be a replica of the Titanic, that would be so wrong...
